div.p: SALIVATION, in medicine, a promoting of the flux of ſaliva, by means of medicines, moſtly by mercury. The chief uſe of ſalivation is in diſeaſes belonging to the glands and membrana adipoſa, and principally in the cure of the venereal diſeaſe; though it is ſometimes alſo uſed in epidemic diſeaſes, cutaneous diſeaſes, &c. whoſe criſes tend that way.
